item.title: 1 A dawn unto his own day
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 1 A dawn unto his own day 8 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, ALMUSTAFA, THE CHOSEN AND THE BELOVED, WHO WAS A DAWN UNTO HIS OWN DAY, HAD WAITED TWELVE YEARS IN THE CITY OF ORPHALESE FOR HIS SHIP THAT WAS TO RETURN AND BEAR HIM BACK TO THE ISLE OF HIS BIRTH. AND IN THE TWELFTH YEAR, ON THE SEVENTH DAY OF IELOOL, THE MONTH OF REAPING, HE CLIMBED THE HILL WITHOUT THE CITY WALLS AND LOOKED SEAWARD; AND HE BEHELD HIS SHIP COMING WITH THE MIST.

item.title: 10 When you give of yourself
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 10 When you give of yourself 13 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN SAID A RICH MAN, SPEAK TO US OF GIVING. AND HE ANSWERED: YOU GIVE BUT LITTLE WHEN YOU GIVE OF YOUR POSSESSIONS. IT IS WHEN YOU GIVE OF YOURSELF THAT YOU TRULY GIVE. FOR WHAT ARE YOUR POSSESSIONS BUT THINGS YOU KEEP AND GUARD FOR FEAR YOU MAY NEED THEM TOMORROW?

item.title: 11 Life gives unto life
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 11 Life gives unto life 13 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, YOU OFTEN SAY, “I WOULD GIVE, BUT ONLY TO THE DESERVING.” THE TREES IN YOUR ORCHARD SAY NOT SO, NOR THE FLOCKS IN YOUR PASTURE. THEY GIVE THAT THEY MAY LIVE, FOR TO WITHHOLD IS TO PERISH. SURELY HE WHO IS WORTHY TO RECEIVE HIS DAYS AND HIS NIGHTS IS WORTHY OF ALL ELSE FROM YOU.

item.title: 12 The wine and the winepress
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 12 The wine and the winepress 14 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN AN OLD MAN, A KEEPER OF AN INN, SAID, SPEAK TO US OF EATING AND DRINKING. AND HE SAID: WOULD THAT YOU COULD LIVE ON THE FRAGRANCE OF THE EARTH, AND LIKE AN AIR PLANT BE SUSTAINED BY THE LIGHT. BUT SINCE YOU MUST KILL TO EAT, AND ROB THE NEWLY BORN OF ITS MOTHER’S MILK TO QUENCH YOUR THIRST, LET IT THEN BE AN ACT OF WORSHIP,

item.title: 13 Speak to us of work
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 13 Speak to us of work 14 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN A PLOUGHMAN SAID, SPEAK TO US OF WORK. AND HE ANSWERED, SAYING: YOU WORK THAT YOU MAY KEEP PACE WITH THE EARTH AND THE SOUL OF THE EARTH. FOR TO BE IDLE IS TO BECOME A STRANGER UNTO THE SEASONS, AND TO STEP OUT OF LIFE’S PROCESSION THAT MARCHES IN MAJESTY AND PROUD SUBMISSION TOWARDS THE INFINITE.

item.title: 14 Work is love made visible
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 14 Work is love made visible 15 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND WHAT IS IT TO WORK WITH LOVE? IT IS TO WEAVE THE CLOTH WITH THREADS DRAWN FROM YOUR HEART, EVEN AS IF YOUR BELOVED WERE TO WEAR THAT CLOTH. IT IS TO BUILD A HOUSE WITH AFFECTION, EVEN AS IF YOUR BELOVED WERE TO DWELL IN THAT HOUSE.

item.title: 15 Beyond joy and sorrow
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 15 Beyond joy and sorrow 15 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN A WOMAN SAID, SPEAK TO US OF JOY AND SORROW. AND HE ANSWERED: YOUR JOY IS YOUR SORROW UNMASKED. AND THE SELFSAME WELL FROM WHICH YOUR LAUGHTER RISES WAS OFTENTIMES FILLED WITH YOUR TEARS. AND HOW ELSE CAN IT BE? THE DEEPER THAT SORROW CARVES INTO YOUR BEING, THE MORE JOY YOU CAN CONTAIN.

item.title: 16 From house to home from home to temple
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 16 From house to home from home to temple 16 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN A MASON CAME FORTH AND SAID, SPEAK TO US OF HOUSES. AND HE ANSWERED AND SAID: BUILD OF YOUR IMAGININGS A BOWER IN THE WILDERNESS ERE YOU BUILD A HOUSE WITHIN THE CITY WALLS. FOR EVEN AS YOU HAVE HOMECOMINGS IN YOUR TWILIGHT, SO HAS THE WANDERER IN YOU, THE EVER-DISTANT AND ALONE.

item.title: 17 The boundless within you
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 17 The boundless within you 16 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND TELL ME, PEOPLE OF ORPHALESE, WHAT HAVE YOU IN THESE HOUSES? AND WHAT IT IS YOU GUARD WITH FASTENED DOORS? HAVE YOU PEACE, THE QUIET URGE THAT REVEALS YOUR POWER? HAVE YOU REMEMBRANCES, THE GLIMMERING ARCHES THAT SPAN THE SUMMITS OF THE MIND? HAVE YOU BEAUTY, THAT LEADS THE HEART FROM THINGS FASHIONED OF WOOD AND STONE TO THE HOLY MOUNTAIN?

item.title: 18 Shame was his loom\...
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 18 Shame was his loom... 17 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND THE WEAVER SAID, SPEAK TO US OF CLOTHES. AND HE ANSWERED: YOUR CLOTHES CONCEAL MUCH OF YOUR BEAUTY, YET THEY HIDE NOT THE UNBEAUTIFUL. AND THOUGH YOU SEEK IN GARMENTS THE FREEDOM OF PRIVACY YOU MAY FIND IN THEM A HARNESS AND A CHAIN. WOULD THAT YOU COULD MEET THE SUN AND THE WIND WITH MORE OF YOUR SKIN AND LESS OF YOUR RAIMENT.

item.title: 19 The gifts of the earth
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 19 The gifts of the earth 17 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND A MERCHANT SAID, SPEAK TO US OF BUYING AND SELLING. AND HE ANSWERED AND SAID: TO YOU THE EARTH YIELDS HER FRUIT, AND YOU SHALL NOT WANT IF YOU BUT KNOW HOW TO FILL YOUR HANDS. IT IS IN EXCHANGING THE GIFTS OF THE EARTH THAT YOU SHALL FIND ABUNDANCE AND BE SATISFIED.

item.title: 2 A boundless drop to a boundless ocean
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 2 A boundless drop to a boundless ocean 9 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, YET I CANNOT TARRY LONGER. THE SEA THAT CALLS ALL THINGS UNTO HER CALLS ME, AND I MUST EMBARK. FOR TO STAY, THOUGH THE HOURS BURN IN THE NIGHT, IS TO FREEZE AND CRYSTALLIZE AND BE BOUND IN A MOULD. FAIN WOULD I TAKE WITH ME ALL THAT IS HERE.

item.title: 20 Crime: a crowd psychology
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 20 Crime: a crowd psychology 18 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN ONE OF THE JUDGES OF THE CITY STOOD FORTH AND SAID, SPEAK TO US OF CRIME AND PUNISHMENT. AND HE ANSWERED, SAYING: IT IS WHEN YOUR SPIRIT GOES WANDERING UPON THE WIND, THAT YOU, ALONE AND UNGUARDED, COMMIT A WRONG UNTO OTHERS AND THEREFORE UNTO YOURSELF.

item.title: 21 Leaves of a single tree
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 21 Leaves of a single tree 18 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, OFTENTIMES HAVE I HEARD YOU SPEAK OF ONE WHO COMMITS A WRONG AS THOUGH HE WERE NOT ONE OF YOU BUT A STRANGER UNTO YOU AND AN INTRUDER UPON YOUR WORLD. BUT I SAY THAT EVEN AS THE HOLY AND THE RIGHTEOUS CANNOT RISE BEYOND THE HIGHEST WHICH IS IN EACH ONE OF YOU,

item.title: 22 Sinners and saints: the drama of sleeping people
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 22 Sinners and saints: the drama of sleeping people 19 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, IF ANY OF YOU WOULD BRING TO JUDGMENT THE UNFAITHFUL WIFE, LET HIM ALSO WEIGH THE HEART OF HER HUSBAND IN SCALES, AND MEASURE HIS SOUL WITH MEASUREMENTS. AND LET HIM WHO WOULD LASH THE OFFENDER LOOK UNTO THE SPIRIT OF THE OFFENDED.

item.title: 3 A seeker of silences
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 3 A seeker of silences 9 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND AS HE WALKED HE SAW FROM AFAR MEN AND WOMEN LEAVING THEIR FIELDS AND THEIR VINEYARDS AND HASTENING TOWARDS THE CITY GATES. AND HE HEARD THEIR VOICES CALLING HIS NAME, AND SHOUTING FROM FIELD TO FIELD TELLING ONE ANOTHER OF THE COMING OF HIS SHIP. AND HE SAID TO HIMSELF:

< Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 4 10 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND WHEN HE ENTERED INTO THE CITY ALL THE PEOPLE CAME TO MEET HIM, AND THEY WERE CRYING OUT TO HIM AS WITH ONE VOICE. AND THE ELDERS OF THE CITY STOOD FORTH AND SAID: GO NOT YET AWAY FROM US. A NOONTIDE HAVE YOU BEEN IN OUR TWILIGHT, AND YOUR YOUTH HAS GIVEN US DREAMS TO DREAM.

item.title: 5 Disclose us to ourselves
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 5 Disclose us to ourselves 10 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND OTHERS CAME ALSO AND ENTREATED HIM. BUT HE ANSWERED THEM NOT. HE ONLY BENT HIS HEAD; AND THOSE WHO STOOD NEAR SAW HIS TEARS FALLING UPON HIS BREAST. AND HE AND THE PEOPLE PROCEEDED TOWARDS THE GREAT SQUARE BEFORE THE TEMPLE. AND THERE CAME OUT OF THE SANCTUARY A WOMAN WHOSE NAME WAS ALMITRA.

item.title: 6 Speak to us of love
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 6 Speak to us of love 11 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN SAID ALMITRA, SPEAK TO US OF LOVE. AND HE RAISED HIS HEAD AND LOOKED UPON THE PEOPLE, AND THERE FELL A STILLNESS UPON THEM. AND WITH A GREAT VOICE HE SAID: WHEN LOVE BECKONS TO YOU, FOLLOW HIM, THOUGH HIS WAYS ARE HARD AND STEEP.

item.title: 7 Love possesses not
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 7 Love possesses not 11 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, LOVE GIVES NAUGHT BUT ITSELF AND TAKES NAUGHT BUT FROM ITSELF. LOVE POSSESSES NOT NOR WOULD IT BE POSSESSED; FOR LOVE IS SUFFICIENT UNTO LOVE. WHEN YOU LOVE YOU SHOULD NOT SAY, “GOD IS IN MY HEART,” BUT RATHER, “I AM IN THE HEART OF GOD.” AND THINK NOT YOU CAN DIRECT THE COURSE OF LOVE, FOR LOVE, IF IT FINDS YOU WORTHY, DIRECTS YOUR COURSE.

item.title: 8 Let there be spaces
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 8 Let there be spaces 12 January 1987 am in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, THEN ALMITRA SPOKE AGAIN AND SAID, AND WHAT OF MARRIAGE, MASTER? AND HE ANSWERED SAYING: YOU WERE BORN TOGETHER, AND TOGETHER YOU SHALL BE FOR EVERMORE. YOU SHALL BE TOGETHER WHEN THE WHITE WINGS OF DEATH SCATTER YOUR DAYS. AYE, YOU SHALL BE TOGETHER EVEN IN THE SILENT MEMORY OF GOD.

item.title: 9 Your children are not your children
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌CHAPTER 9 Your children are not your children 12 January 1987 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium BELOVED OSHO, AND A WOMAN WHO HELD A BABE AGAINST HER BOSOM SAID, SPEAK TO US OF CHILDREN. AND HE SAID: YOUR CHILDREN ARE NOT YOUR CHILDREN. THEY ARE THE SONS AND DAUGHTERS OF LIFE’S LONGING FOR ITSELF. THEY COME THROUGH YOU BUT NOT FROM YOU, AND THOUGH THEY ARE WITH YOU YET THEY BELONG NOT TO YOU.
